caption.p: Ginsenoside transformation pathways during biological processing. The sugar moieties linked to C–3, C–6, or C–20 in the major ginsenosides are hydrolyzed by microorganisms, commercial enzymes, or recombinant enzymes; on the other hand, glycose molecules or activated sugars are conjugated to the aglycones of ginsenosides (glycosylation) by glycosyl hydrolase or glycosyltransferases, respectively. UDP, uridine diphosphate.
